news.title: AI tools used by English councils downplay women’s health issues, study finds
news.summary: LSE research finds risk of gender bias in care decisions made based on AI summaries of case notes. Language such as ‘disabled’, ‘unable’ and ‘complex’ appeared significantly more often in descriptions of men than women.

news.title: Wikipedia can challenge Online Safety Act if strictest rules apply to it, says judge
news.summary: Wikimedia Foundation says it will be forced reduce access to site if it is classified as a category 1 provider by Ofcom. High court judge gives foundation permission to challenge the Online Safety Act.

news.title: End of an era: AOL to discontinue its dial-up internet service after 30 years
news.summary: The hisses, pings and screeches that introduced millions of Americans to the online world will be retired in September. AOL, or America Online, said  recently it was discontinuing the old school connection option.

news.title: Cat soap operas and babies trapped in space: the ‘AI slop’ taking over YouTube
news.summary: Nearly one in 10 of the fastest growing YouTube channels globally consist of mass-produced, surreal AI-generated videos. Super Cat League (3.9 million subscribers), LSB POWER GAMING (1.7 million subscribers) and MIRANHAINSANO (4.9million subscribers)

news.title: Nvidia and AMD agree to pay 15% of China chip export revenues to US
news.summary: Unprecedented deal, an apparent reversal of security restrictions, is in return for licences to sell to China. Nvidia and AMD have agreed to give the US government 15% of their revenue from advanced chips sold to China in exchange for export licences.

news.title: I want my faulty earbud fixed. Should it cost less than replacing the pair?
news.summary: With a growing e-waste problem, you’re right to pursue a repair, writes policy professional Kat George. Your consumer rights extend beyond a product’s warranty too.

news.title: Tiny Bookshop review – a truly cosy escape made with readers in mind
news.summary: Tiny Bookshop is a resource management simulator set in a retail or service environment. Real titles from Shakespeare to John Green line the shelves of your seaside shop in a rhythmic, mellow management simulator.
